heaviest_rainfall.status: 47.89mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 09 November 2025, marking an exceptional 144.8 hour precipitation event.  At times the rain was falling at 24.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: A torrential downpour occurred on 02 September 2025 when the rain reached a maximum intensity of 34.3mm per hour.  This happened during a 15.0 hour storm when 21.19mm of rain fell.

longest_rain.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 09 November 2025, it lasted 144.8 hours and it delivered 47.89mm of rain at a maximum rate of 24.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The highest recorded number of lightning strikes in a single day is {highest_count} on {highest_date} since records began on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: A storm is passing through the area.  This marks the first storm since 06 February 2026.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 13 January 2026 and lasted for 22 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 3 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.6.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is not a heatwaves right now.  There have been 0 this year, compared to a usual average of 1.9.

tropical.status: The previous tropical night was on 18 July 2025, with only 62 in total since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is south-westerly (217°).  In the UK, a south-westerly wind often means mild and wet weather.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 128.2 mph from 27 January 2026.

run.status: The top recorded wind run is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The largest wind speed ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.7 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in rainfall (up 0.7 mm) and pressure (down 6 mbar).

The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (up 0.3 mm) and feels like temperature (down 1.6°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 28.2m higher than yesterday, 56.3m lower than the past week, 71.6m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 557m to 849m and averaged 699.8m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.

summary.summary: Inside; a mild and comfortable temperature is anticipated. Outside; cold weather is expected. Also, the air will feel dry and very little to no wind will be present. Showers, low clouds are expected, possibly some fog or persistent clouds, and periods of sunshine are expected. Low pressure may bring unsettled weather.

washing.phrase: The humidity is too high (93%) for your washing to dry quickly.  Any drying will take longer than usual.
